examples: Porous rock allows water to seep through easily.
The river deposited silt along its banks, enriching the soil.
Debris can clog irrigation channels and prevent water flow.
The dike protected the farmland from seasonal flooding.
The inundation of the valley forced thousands to evacuate.
Heavy rains inundated the low-lying areas near the river.
The empire faced a serious predicament when the river changed course.
The emperor convened his advisors to discuss the flooding crisis.
Local leaders pledged to contribute resources for flood control.
Poor infrastructure hindered efforts to manage the water system.
The fertile land produced abundant crops for the empire.
Scribes reproduced important documents for distribution.
The inscription on the monument commemorated the flood control project.
Workers erected a massive stone monument to honor the emperor.
The engineer received an award for his meritorious service.
The plan had merit but required significant resources.
The neutralization of flood threats required coordinated efforts.
The monsoon season brought heavy rains and flooding.
Agriculture was the foundation of the empire's economy.
Seasonal flooding was inevitable in the river valley.
The emperor imposed new taxes to fund irrigation projects.
Several principalities united under the empire's rule.
The principal concern was preventing catastrophic flooding.
Imperial decrees mandated cooperation on water management.
The empire controlled vast territories along the river.
Farmers customarily planted crops after the flood season.
It was customary to offer prayers before major construction projects.
Grazing lands were located on higher ground away from floods.
The military launched an offensive to secure water resources.
The empire promoted cultural homogeneity across its territories.
Scientists invoke plate tectonics to explain mountain formation.
Terrestrial mountains differ significantly from underwater formations.
The expedition explored uncharted territory in the mountain range.
The contraction of Earth's crust creates compressional forces.
The incandescent lava flowed down the mountainside.
Tectonic forces deform rock layers over millions of years.
Alfred Wegener popularized the theory of continental drift.
The theory must accommodate new evidence from ocean floor studies.
Earth's crust is divided into several tectonic plates.
The ocean basin contains the deepest parts of the seafloor.
The age distribution of ocean rocks was perplexing to early geologists.
The discovery perplexed scientists who expected older rocks.
The puzzle of seafloor spreading was solved in the 1960s.
Magnetic stripes interleave across the ocean floor.
The interleaving pattern of rock types indicates periodic volcanic activity.
Sediment accumulates on the ocean floor over time.
Rivers deposit sediment in deltas where they meet the ocean.
Stratigraphic analysis reveals the history of rock formation.
Different strata contain fossils from different time periods.
The striking symmetry of magnetic patterns confirmed seafloor spreading.
The absence of old oceanic crust was a major conundrum.
Scientists attribute mountain building to plate collisions.
Feldspar is a common mineral in continental crust.
Olivine is abundant in the Earth's mantle and oceanic crust.
Pyroxene minerals are found in basaltic rocks.
Volcanic craters dot the landscape of the island chain.
The seafloor subsides as it moves away from the mid-ocean ridge.
Paleontology provides evidence for the age of rock formations.
Wind and water erode mountains over geological time.
The reservoir supplies water to millions of people in the city.
Africa has vast untapped natural resources that could boost its economy.
The light diffused through the frosted glass, creating a soft glow.
Companies exploit renewable energy sources to reduce carbon emissions.
Geothermal energy can be tapped to generate electricity in volcanic regions.
The river was dammed to impound water for irrigation purposes.
Coastal cities must contend with rising sea levels due to climate change.
Scientists contend that ocean currents play a crucial role in climate regulation.
Hydroelectric power plants convert the energy of flowing water into electricity.
Hydropower is one of the oldest sources of renewable energy.
The wave reached its crest before crashing onto the shore.
The buoy marked the safe swimming area in the ocean.
The Gulf of Mexico is known for its warm waters and diverse marine life.
The high cost of installation precludes many homeowners from using solar panels.
It was evident from the artifacts that the civilization was highly advanced.
She studied archaeology to understand ancient human civilizations.
Archaeologists excavated the site and discovered pottery from 3000 BCE.
The excavation revealed a complex network of underground tunnels.
This museum is dedicated to preserving ancient Roman artifacts.
Clay vessels were used to store grain and water in ancient times.
The lapidary carefully carved intricate designs into the precious stones.
Ancient looms were used to weave textiles from wool and cotton.
Weaving was an important craft in many ancient societies.
The tomb was sealed from the outside world for thousands of years.
The archive contains thousands of documents from the medieval period.
Obsidian was prized for making sharp cutting tools and weapons.
The pottery had a distinctive reddish color from the iron-rich clay.
The smithy was where metalworkers forged tools and weapons.
Toxic fumes from the smelting process filled the workshop.
Different archaeologists have different interpretations of the site's purpose.
The museum displays various types of ceramic ware from different periods.
Each culture has distinct pottery styles that help identify their origin.
The ancient city was utterly destroyed by the earthquake.
Provincial workshops produced goods for local markets rather than trade.

words.meaning: to leave; to give upEx: To saves their lives, the sailors had to abandon the shinking ship.Part of speech: abandonment (n)
examples: To saves their lives, the sailors had to abandon the shinking ship.Part of speech: abandonment (n)

words.meaning: In a harmful way; negativelyEx: Excessive rainfall early in the spring can adversely affect the planting of crops.His studies are adversely affected b
examples: Excessive rainfall early in the spring can adversely affect the planting of crops.His studies are adversely affected by his family situation.Her health was adversely affected by the climate. Usage tips Aversely is often followed by effect.Parts of Speech adversity (n), adverse (adj)

words.meaning: (adj) Gathered into or amounting to a wholeIt is impossible to judge last year's performance without knowing the aggregate sales numbers.Usage tips Ag
(n) Preparing the land to grow crops; improvement for agricultural purposesWith the development of land cultivation, hunters and gatherers were able t

Jacob's long absence intensified his certainty that he should marry RoseViolence intensified during the night. The opposition leader has intensified h
examples: Jacob's long absence intensified his certainty that he should marry RoseViolence intensified during the night. The opposition leader has intensified his attacks on the government. (~ sth)Part of speech intensification (n), intense (adj)

words.meaning: n. The supplying of water to dry land.Ex: In dry areas of the country, you can see ditches all over the farmland for irrigation.Parts of speech irriga

words.meaning: v. To gain possesion of; to getEx: After a series of difficult interviews, he finally was able to obtain the job.
examples: After a series of difficult interviews, he finally was able to obtain the job.

examples: Oxygen is a by-product of the process of photosynthesis.Parts of seech photosynthesize (v)

words.meaning: n. Water that fall to the Earth's surfaceEx: In the Pacific Northwest, the high level of precipitation ensures rich, green plant life.
examples: In the Pacific Northwest, the high level of precipitation ensures rich, green plant life.

words.meaning: v. To expect; to sense something before it happensEx: By placing sensors in earthquake-prone areas, scientists can anticipate some tremors in time to
examples: By placing sensors in earthquake-prone areas, scientists can anticipate some tremors in time to warn the public.Parts of speech anticipation n, anticipatory adj

words.meaning: adj. Extremely harmful; causing financial or physical ruinEx: The architect died in a catastrophic elevator accident.Parts of speech catastrophe n [k
examples: The architect died in a catastrophic elevator accident.Parts of speech catastrophe n [k'tstrfi] catastrophically adv [,kt'strfikli]

words.meaning: v. To come together with great or violent forceEx: As usual, their holiday was ruined when their in-laws views on politics collided with their own.Th
examples: As usual, their holiday was ruined when their in-laws views on politics collided with their own.The car and the van collided head-on in thick fog. The car collided head-on with the van. (~ with sth/sb)As he fell, his head collided with the table. They regularly collide over policy decisions. Parts of speech collision n
